page.title: 14OLD HALL FARM,TANDRIDGE LANE
page.content: {Old Hall Farm}is a small mixed farming unit of 45 acres. It is run by the Nunn family. They have owned the farm for nine years. For part of the time they lived away from the unit until a new self built bungalow was ready for them to occupy some five years ago. About forty bullocks are reared on the farm for beef. They are butchered locally and the produce sold from the farm. A few sheep are stocked mainly for their wool. Some weeks before Christmas over 1200 turkeys are reared and fattened for the seasonal market. A few acres of land is used to grow barley which contributes towards animal feedstuffs for the farm animals.
